answers.answer: Swelling on just one side could be a sign of preaclampsia, which is pretty serious. Call your OB and go to the hospital, have them check your blood pressure.
How high would my blood pressure have to be to get this i normally run 100/60 my last visit was 130 something over 78ish cant really remember
Anything over 140/90 is considered high blood pressure in pregnancy. But don't mess around with this, like I said it could be pretty serious. Go get checked ASAP.

I'm not sure how high it would have to be, but definitely something to get checked out even if it is nothing. Swelling is a big sign of preeclampsia and is very serious and dangerous to both baby and mommy.

question: So this is my 3rd baby so i pretty much know what to expect from pregnancy but this is a new one even for me my one foot an ankle are swollen just the right one nothing on the left. Xavier is on my siatic nerve so i dont know if thats y its only on the right side. Has this happen to anyone else?
title: Swelling!!!!
